speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: SCENE IV. Rome. A public place.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Enter MENENIUS and SICINIUS

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: See you yond coign o' the Capitol, yond

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: corner-stone?

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Why, what of that?

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: If it be possible for you to displace it with your

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: little finger, there is some hope the ladies of

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Rome, especially his mother, may prevail with him.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: But I say there is no hope in't: our throats are

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: sentenced and stay upon execution.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Is't possible that so short a time can alter the

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: condition of a man!

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: There is differency between a grub and a butterfly;

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: yet your butterfly was a grub. This Marcius is grown

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: from man to dragon: he has wings; he's more than a

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: creeping thing.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: He loved his mother dearly.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: So did he me: and he no more remembers his mother

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: now than an eight-year-old horse. The tartness

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: of his face sours ripe grapes: when he walks, he

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: moves like an engine, and the ground shrinks before

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: his treading: he is able to pierce a corslet with

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: his eye; talks like a knell, and his hum is a

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: battery. He sits in his state, as a thing made for

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Alexander. What he bids be done is finished with

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: his bidding. He wants nothing of a god but eternity

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: and a heaven to throne in.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Yes, mercy, if you report him truly.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: I paint him in the character. Mark what mercy his

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: mother shall bring from him: there is no more mercy

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: in him than there is milk in a male tiger; that

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: shall our poor city find: and all this is long of

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: you.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: The gods be good unto us!

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: No, in such a case the gods will not be good unto

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: us. When we banished him, we respected not them;

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: and, he returning to break our necks, they respect not us.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Sir, if you'ld save your life, fly to your house:

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The plebeians have got your fellow-tribune

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: And hale him up and down, all swearing, if

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The Roman ladies bring not comfort home,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: They'll give him death by inches.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Enter a second Messenger

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: What's the news?

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: Good news, good news; the ladies have prevail'd,

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: The Volscians are dislodged, and Marcius gone:

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: A merrier day did never yet greet Rome,

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: No, not the expulsion of the Tarquins.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Friend,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Art thou certain this is true? is it most certain?

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: As certain as I know the sun is fire:

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: Where have you lurk'd, that you make doubt of it?

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: Ne'er through an arch so hurried the blown tide,

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: As the recomforted through the gates. Why, hark you!

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: Trumpets; hautboys; drums beat; all together

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: The trumpets, sackbuts, psalteries and fifes,

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: Tabours and cymbals and the shouting Romans,

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: Make the sun dance. Hark you!

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: A shout within

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: This is good news:

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: I will go meet the ladies. This Volumnia

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Is worth of consuls, senators, patricians,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: A city full; of tribunes, such as you,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: A sea and land full. You have pray'd well to-day:

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: This morning for ten thousand of your throats

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: I'd not have given a doit. Hark, how they joy!

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Music still, with shouts

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: First, the gods bless you for your tidings; next,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Accept my thankfulness.

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: Sir, we have all

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: Great cause to give great thanks.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: They are near the city?

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: Almost at point to enter.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: We will meet them,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: And help the joy.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Exeunt
